section.title: Managing Swift Rings
section.para: Swift rings are a machine-readable description of which disk drives are used by the Object Storage service (for example, a drive is used to store account or object data). Rings also specify the policy for data storage (for example, defining the number of replicas). The rings are automatically built during the initial deployment of your cloud, with the configuration provided during setup of the Input Model. (For more information, see .)

After successful deployment of your cloud, you may want to change or modify the configuration for Swift. For example, you may want to add or remove Swift nodes, add additional storage policies, or upgrade the size of the disk drives. For instructions, see Applying Input Model Changes to Existing Rings and Adding a New Storage Policy - Swift.

note.para: The process of modifying or adding a configuration is similar to other configuration or topology changes in the cloud. Generally, you make the changes to the input model files at ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ on the lifecycle manager and then run Ansible playbooks to reconfigure the system.

section.para: Changes to the rings require several phases to complete, therefore, you may need to run the playbooks several times over several days.
